name: •  The Crisis and The Self  •
description: The essential is contingency. I mean that existence is not necessity. To exist is simply to be there. Existents appear, they allow themselves to be found, but it is never possible to deduce them. No necessary being can explain existence, contingency is not a mask, it is the absolute. "We were a heap of uncomfortable existences, pregnant by ourselves; we had not the slightest reason to be there. ourselves; we had not the slightest reason to be there, neither one nor the other; each one of the existents, confused, vague, vague, vague, vague, vague. of the existents, confused, vaguely uneasy, felt himself to be more than the others. the others. I - sluggish, languid, obscene, leading, stirring melancholy thoughts - I too was extra."
